intro: Paraboea rufescens var. tomentosa, commonly known as the woolly paraboea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. The varietal form, tomentosa, is distinguished by its dense, woolly pubescence on the stems and leaves.
